section.title: Introduction
section.p: YAJUL is a set of Java utility libraries for Java enterprise application development. The libraries are organize by the type of useage, allowing a lightweight implementation. The core library is required by all other libraries, and includes Log4J logging, IO utilities, XML DOM / SAX / XSLT utilities, and some multi-threading code. Other libraries include: Servlet, EDI, and development tools.

section.title: Why?
section.p: Every Java application, particularly web based business applications have some common code that is developed over and over again. YAJUL provides a shareable repository for reliable (tested) and well documented reuseable code.

ul.li: Provide well documented libraries. The libraries can be used without resorting to looking at the source code.
Unit test all the production code. Programmers can trust the libraries.
Minimal dependencies. The user should be able to include a minimal set of libraries.

section.title: Core Library
section.p: The core library includes logging, IO utilities, XML DOM XML DOM / SAX / XSLT utilities, and multi-threading utilities.
